A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Spoilers: I was amazed how Ryan Johnson took the risk of not just giving you what you thought was important and not just making a repeat of another Star Wars movie but it’s own individual type of story with twist and turns but that was still very much Star Wars. It had flaws but so does a lot of movies. I came to enjoy A MOVIE not a religious event\, and I did. And I also don’t think that we know the truth about Rey still\, but the fact that her heritage doesn’t matter just goes to show how the force works. I’m glad they killed snoke cuz I don’t need another emperor I need something fresh and shocking and I was shocked by that scene. Finn’s story line was definitely the flaw in the movie BUT EVEN THAT was at least enjoyable to a degree. All in all the immense struggle\, nail biting adventure\, plot twists NOBODY saw coming and yes even silly humor makes this a classic Star Wars like we haven’t seen in a long time.
